form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Blumenthal introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to ensure veterans of secrecy oath programs receive the full benefits they have earned, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Obligations to Aberdeen’s Trusted Heroes Act of 2025 or the OATH Act of 2025.
Section 5100 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The term secrecy oath program means a United States Government program in which participants are required to sign a non-disclosure agreement preventing the disclosure of any information regarding the program under penalty of court-martial or criminal punishment.

section.header: Notice to veterans of secrecy oath programs regarding benefits

paragraph.text: Section 6303 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsections (c), (d), and (e) as subsections (d), (e), and (f), respectively; and
by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection (c):

subsection.header: Notice to veterans of secrecy oath programs

paragraph.text: Not later than 90 days after the date on which participants in a secrecy oath program are released from the oath taken under such program, the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: identify the veterans who participated in the program;
notify each such veteran of all benefits and services under laws administered by the Department for which the veteran may be eligible; and
distribute the information described in subsection (d)(1) as required by such subsection.

paragraph.text: If the Secretary identifies any veterans who are entitled to notice under paragraph (1) and did not receive such notice, the Secretary shall, not later than 90 days after the date of any such identification—

subparagraph.text: notify each such veteran of all benefits and services under laws administered by the Department for which the veteran may be eligible; and
distribute the information described in subsection (d)(1) as required by such subsection.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term secrecy oath program has the meaning given that term in section 5100 of this title.
Section 6303 of such title is further amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking through (d) and inserting through (e); and
in subsection (e), as redesignated by subsection (a)(1)(A), by striking subsections (b) and (c) and inserting subsections (b), (c), and (d).

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall—

paragraph.text: identify the veterans who participated in the secrecy oath program at Edgewood Arsenal at Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland, at any time during the period beginning on January 1, 1948, and ending on December 31, 1975;
notify each such veteran of all benefits and services under laws administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs for which the veteran may be eligible; and
distribute the information described in section 6303(d)(1) of title 38, United States Code, as amended by subsection (a), as required by such section.

section.header: Effective dates of awards of disability compensation for participants in secrecy oath programs
section.text: Section 5110(b) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: The effective date of an award of disability compensation to a veteran described in subparagraph (B) shall be the day following the date of the veteran’s discharge or release.
A veteran described in this subparagraph is a veteran who—

clause.text: participated in the secrecy oath program at Edgewood Arsenal at Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland, at any time during the period beginning on January 1, 1948, and ending on December 31, 1975; or
participated in any other secrecy oath program not described in clause (i).
